H0.text: From which country did French horns originate. France

H1.text: From which country did French horns originate. Germany

H2.text: From which country did French horns originate. Austria

H3.text: From which country did French horns originate. Nimska

A4.text: The name 'French horn' first came into use in the late 17th century. At that time, French makers were preeminent in the manufacture of hunting horns and were credited with creating the now-familiar, circular 'hoop' shape of the instrument.

A5.text: German makers first devised crooks to make such horns playable in different keysâ€”so musicians came to use 'French' and 'German' to distinguish the simple hunting horn from the newer horn with crooks.
